I was working with SageMath[1] as a newbie, that is an open source mathematics software system, in my computer to learning the `nth_root' functionality, but I confronted with weird and maybe wrong result!!! 

Please see below. Can you help me to find the right flag?

sage: from flag import flag
sage: p = 3704221942249639571247497734847970204473794487557627215591263315015028361136622761830685588665434210431631209918667822817492933827934113438696935593364630437
sage: m = int(flag.encode('hex'), 16)
sage: m < p
True
sage: c = pow(m, 31337, p)
sage: c
1389106458179177596030273931628993816666113685525519208313193470340449218245126677214976628739637710148599279188447897492016231677364389938978667307152081498
sage: M = c.nth_root(31337)
sage: M
2930102242490288938968199113831332314952570519607670511271645407112149251155000940275722333178466007542994767577347789394328070038052589587004075983647413695
sage: M == m
False

[1]: https://www.sagemath.org
